title: Dynamical forecast model skill in the Colombian agricultural context, joint work between Fedearroz, IDEAM, CIAT-CCAFS and University of Leeds
narrative: We evaluated multiple approaches to developing robust and highly skilled forecasts of dynamical models in the Colombian context and with the leadership from FEDEARROZ, on the assessment of WRF model was implemented in their servers. Strong ties with UK-Met-Office. The WRF that is implemented as part of the CSRD-Colombia effort.

title: ‘Contour bunding’ preserves soils and boosts farmers’ incomes by 20% in Mali – new study
narrative: In Mali  contour bunding technique retained moisture and nutrients while preventing soil erosion also brings as much as 20% increase in net income. The technology reduces water runoff and controls soil erosion through ridges covered with perennial grasses such as Andropogon and Vetiver. Farmers use the ridges for crop production.

title: Policy augmented scaling model for a fully validated CSAP-the happy seeder technology to curb air pollution and build resilience.
narrative: To maximise impact, the innovation is inter-connected& coherent reflecting the priorities of the national economy. Supports culturing socio-economic-environmental development wherein collaborators bringing their comparative advantages to strengthen science of scaling for accelerated uptake of happyseeder via models favouring sustainable development with policy oriented towards leveraging technology base for site-specific use.

title: Iron Beans: INTA BIODOR (SMR 88)
narrative: New variety of iron beans.  As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Monitoring and Evaluation of Land in Africa (MELA) framework
narrative: The MELA framework is being piloted by 12 countries in Africa.  This allows tracking of progress on commitments made under the AU Declaration on Land Governance in Africa, including commitments to land rights for women and special groups, e.g. pastoralists.

title: Multi-level ICT-based Smart Monitoring to track CSA performance and outcomes
narrative:
This novel ICT-based instrument allows to track performance and outcomes of CSA options across multiple levels, providing sound metrics to address:
- synergies and trade-offs at plot level, 
- effects on Food/Livelihood Security, Adaptation  and Gender dimensions at household level, 
- and adoption enablers and constraints at community level.

title: ClimMob, a digital platform for large-N on-farm experimentation with climate adaptation options
narrative: Digital platform for scaled on-farm farmer-participatory evaluations of agricultural technologies

title: Mobile data entry for manual data
narrative: We developed Google Forms based online data entry app that our field assistants have been using to provide manually measured daily discharge data. Previously manual data was only available after 4-6 months because data was only recorded in data registers that had to be transported to and transcribed in Kathmandu.

title: A new global data set on farm size distribution by country
narrative: As part of a study on "Farming and the geography of nutrient production for human use: a transdisciplinary analysis", we developed a new set of global datasets on production of vitamin A, vitamin B₁₂, folate, iron, zinc, calcium, calories, and protein, and the relative contribution of farms of different sizes

title: Designing low cost water haresting system for Bundelkhand region and rejuvinating Haveli system
narrative: To over come water scarcity situation of Bundelkhand, traditional water harvesting system called as “haveli system” need to be rejuvenated. A huge earthen bund to be constructed across the stream to join two adjacent hillocks/stream network to impound water during the monsoon

title: Voice calls for remote data collection
narrative: ICRAF with WFP and LSHTM evaluated the use of using voice calls over mobile phones to collect data remotely. This innovation reduces the costs of data collection and allows monitoring in difficult to access areas. We tested this on nutrition indicators, it is adaptable to others.

title: Silvopastoral systems for degrading lands in the Colombian Amazon
narrative: A silvopastoral system conventional model was modified to suit particular farm characteristics. As a result the conventional silvopastoral systems, with high tree density, existing pastures, and non-native species, was modified by a system that includes native and alien species, improved pastures, trees dispersed or in barriers and short cycle crops.

title: AloWeather - ICT tool for delivering agroadvisory service to farmers
narrative: Aloweather is a fee-based technical solution that provides locally-relevant, accessible, and actionable weather forecasts and advisories through SMS and voice message interactions. Voice response message from users will improve the concept. Currently, farmers will subscribe to the service and pay for it, however other solutions are possible.

title: Systems modelling (whole farm) as decision support evaluating impact of SLM strategies of household cashflows
narrative: Whole-farm  stochastic modelling approach  allowed us to analyze  trade-offs  and outcomes associated with potential farm systems change on simulated farms with varied cropping systems in each of the five selected districts. It provides us contrasting outcomes  in terms of farm household’s cash flows considering modern inputs, labour and market price.

title: Characterization of farms in terms of proximity to the natural state and in terms of their contribution to landscape connectivity
narrative: To achieve this goal, a series of field studies have been carried out by surveying several aspects such as biodiversity, agricultural practices, environmental quality and  cultural aspects. The outcome of this study will be a classification of farms that contribute more to structural landscape connectivity.

title: Farm record keeping: A must tool for  gender enabled CSAPs scaling strategy for development
narrative: Valuing role of women in improved socio-economics of agriculture, farm record keeping has been found as key mechanism to improve women's access and control over resources for better understanding, decision making and advocacy for the beneficial technologies for better income and cope climatic risk

title: Index measured gender equitable knowledge for CSAPs adoption assuring food & nutrition security under climatic risks: Bihar, India
narrative: Agrarian economies such as India are vulnerable to climate shocks extended to food crises& migration. The impact of gender segregated interventions by introducing CSAPs for adaptation are studied capturing the knowledge index. Findings indicate that greater knowledge of CSAPs lead to improved adoption and better nutrition intake of adopters

title: Soil Data Manager
narrative: A web application for evaluation and local adaptation of large-scale (open) soil maps

title: WorldFish-ANU fish sector model
narrative: novel fish sector model (a modified version of AsiaFish model) at national and sub-national level. The innovation is that it reduces the requirements for input data, to suit the Africa context (minimum data requirement).

title: Field experiments and impact evaluations for agricultural extension and advisory services
narrative: Proof of concept and successful pilots of ICT-enabled extension approaches (e.g. Direct Phone Calls with Basic Extension Messages) in Cambodia, Ethiopia, and Uganda accompanied by rigorous evaluation designs to assess impact on farmer knowledge uptake, technology adoption, and improvements in output, yields, and livelihoods.

title: Data Africa
narrative: An award-winning open-access agriculture, climate, poverty, and health data visualization engine.

title: bECON for Africa
narrative: a database of the economics literature on the impact of Genetically Modified Crops in Africa.

title: DREAMpy Dynamic Research Evaluation for Management
narrative: it is a computer tool for the economic assessment of technology and returns to R&D investments. This is an updated version in Python of the older DREAM tool developed at IFPRI

title: REEAP – Rapid Economic Assessment Platform
narrative: A collection of tools and methods focused on the evaluation of the economic impact of agricultural biotechnologies

title: Two-chamber gasifier cook stove
narrative: Gasifier energy systems allow to significantly reduce firewood consumption and emission of greenhouse gasses, while generating biochar for use in crop production.

title: Allometric framework for estimating soil C sequestration on smallholder farmer fields
narrative: The amount of biochar that can be produced from residues of crops on farmer fields needs to be estimated in order to determine the viability of sequestering carbon through the scaling of biomass gasification technologies.

title: Satellite imagery as an alternative to collect data through surveys
narrative: For > 10 years, CIAT team working on climate-site-specific agronomy have struggled to collect through surveys data on harvesting, planting date, phenological stages, etc. Satellite imagery seems to be an alternative to automate this task and in particular for small-scale farmers. Satellites have roven one of the best alternatives.

title: Crop-Loss Assessment Monitor
narrative: CAM is a tool to develop a hybrid index for crop loss assessment using multiple indicators of weather, remote sensing and crop growth simulation modelling.

title: The Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Compendium
narrative: The Compendium is a dataset and set of analytic routines that documents and facilitates meta-analysis of published literature on the impact of agricultural interventions on productivity, resilience and mitigation. The Compendium contains data on more than 70 technologies and more than 40 indicators of outcomes.

title: Demonstrating utility of global system for sharing  genetic resources to national policy makers system through local climate change vulnerability analysis
narrative: Using combined climate and GIS data, genebank accession passport information, participatory research on impacts of climate change on local crops to identify materials in national and international genebanks potentially adapted to local conditions. Taking results to national policy makers to demonstrate why they need to implement/use the Plant Treaty

title: Equations for stationary NIRS for Urochloa humidicola
narrative: 3 new equations developed

title: New Brachiaria hybrid "Camello"
narrative: 1 new Brachiaria hybrid (Camello) available for uptake

title: Napier grass core population
narrative: Core population of Napier grass established for use in further research

title: Method for cost-benefit analysis of improved forage technologies
narrative: Method for cost-benefit analysis of improved forage technologies

title: Heat stress mapping for pigs in Uganda
narrative: Heat stress mapping for pigs in Uganda

title: CLEANED Tools
narrative: The CLEANED (Comprehensive Livestock Environmental Assessment for Improved Nutrition, a Secured Environment and Sustainable Development along Livestock and Fish Value Chains) tool allows users to model the impacts of changes in livestock production systems and value chains on land use, productivity, economics, water impacts, greenhouse gas emissions and soil health.

title: Index based livestock insurance in Ethiopia
narrative: Innovative disaster risk financing methodology, including a suite of products, studies, tools and piloted processes.

title: Method that improved area selection and consistently enhance forecast skill.
narrative: Area selection can be a time-consuming and cumbersome-process. Based on these early results, we sought to develop a method that could improve area selection and consistently enhance forecast skill. The process was fully automated in R. Forecast skill depends very much on the predicted region and season of the forecast.

title: Policy-oriented national LED assessments
narrative: In Vietnam, Kenya and Ethiopia, national LED assessments and investment analyses were conducted with the intent of supporting both national policy and climate finance proposals. Linking these two analyses was an innovation that furthered national progress on NDC implementation, especially in Vietnam.

title: Collective action games to strengthen resource governance
narrative: None provided

title: Climate Wizard
narrative: Climate Wizard is an online tool providing access to downscaled climate change information for a wide range of uses from more technical to less technical.

title: CSA Country Profiles
narrative: Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) country profiles give an overview of the agricultural challenges in countries around the world, and how CSA can help them adapt to and mitigate climate change. Developed by CIAT and CCAFS, in partnership with the World Bank

title: Climate Risk Profiles
narrative: CIAT has developed climate risk profiles to guide CSA investments and priorities at sub national level. the profiles provide an analysis of the underlying causes of vulnerability, ongoing adaptation strategies and existing off-farm services available for combating the risks associated with the hazards, with recommendations for potential adaptation options.

title: Estimating minimum nitrogen requirements (N gaps) for yield gap closure and greenhouse gas mitigation
narrative: Complementary to yield gap concept we developed a protocol to derive minimum N input requirements to achieve fixed levels of yield gap closure (maize) in nine countries in SSA. Realising yield gap closure in this manner is GHG efficient due to low emissions per kg maize and avoiding area expansion

title: Innovative solar powered milk cooling system
narrative: Field testing of an innovative solar powered milk cooling solution for the higher efficiency of the dairy subsector in Tunisia

title: The Producers Organisation Sustainability Assessment (POSA)
narrative: Tool designed with project partners under the East Africa Dairy Development project (EADD) led by Heifer International.

title: Women Empowerment in Livestock Index (WELI)
narrative: Development and piloting of WELI in Tanzania

title: Smallholder dairy training manual
narrative: Reference manual containing the learning material from an intensive, four week training course.

title: Vitamin A Orange Maize: MH44A
narrative: New variety of vitamin A maize.  As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Rice: DRR Dhan 49
narrative: New variety of zinc rice.  As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Rice: Binadhan 20
narrative: New variety of zinc rice.  As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: 1 farmer, 1 loan, 1 IoT raingauge: piloting the industrialization of recyclable, $50 connected rain gauges in Africa
narrative: Spatio-temporal fragmentation of tropical rainfall severely constrains the local relevance of low-density AWS network and satellite RFE data for climate risk management in smallholder agriculture, including for insurance. NADiRA helps industrialize production of cheap, recyclable connected raingauges in Africa, affordably streaming daily rainfall through GSM and NB-IoT. Target capex: $50/unit.

title: Activation of subnational platform to broker institutional changes
narrative: To promote stakeholder engagement in research and outreach, the project adopted a multi-scalar approach centered on the creation of science-policy dialogue platforms at sub-national (district) levels. The district platforms have a more operational role. In Ghana,  there are different hosts – the traditional chief, agricultural extension service, and local NGO.

title: Collective action games to strengthen resource governance
narrative: IFPRI, ICRAF, and partners tested whether experimental games, usually used to measure collective action, can contribute to improved governance of shared resources. Based on promising pilot results our NGO partners are applying these games in other areas, and we documented them on website and online community of practice.

title: Perception of Climate Change and Impact on Land Allocation and Income: Evidence from Vietnam’s Delta Region
narrative: This study examines factors affecting households’ perceptions of climate change and the impact on income and land allocation. Smallholders with perceived climate changes reduce land allocated to paddy crop. Farmers make strategic decision by increasing the amount of rented land, while at the same time decreasing the owned land.

title: Assessing the Potential of Climate Smart Agriculture in Large Rice Field Models in Vietnam
narrative: This study assesses the economic, social, and environmental impacts of Large Field Models (LFMs) and their potential for promoting Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA). Results of this study show that LFMs offer the opportunity to apply CSA principles, reduced production costs, the potential for knowledge sharing, and reduced greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions.

title: Innovative underground storage for mitigating water disasters and building climate resilience
narrative: A new innovation (UTFI) has been developed that converts water-related disasters into rural livelihood opportunities that enhances community resilience. Piloting has been successful and influenced policy in India with plans for next-level scaling-up. The solution has just been recognized by the UN in World Water Development Report for 2018.

title: Collected measures of farmer preferences over risk and ambiguity using direct elicitation and behavioral games in a large sample
narrative: We collected endline data on risk and ambiguity aversion for the sample that comprised the census for the study. This is a sample of over 13,000 households and is the largest every collection of such data, which will be used to analyze how risk and ambiguity preferences affect technology adoption.

title: Testing an approach to screen and treat maternal depression through group therapy to improve newborn child outcomes in Ethiopia
narrative: This approach screens new mothers for depression and offers treatment through interpersonal therapy in groups (IPT-G).  Maternal post-partum depression is associated with poorer child outcomes and IPT-G can alleviate depression symptom.  This study will test whether cash transfers boost effectiveness of IPT-G for improving child outcomes in Ethiopia.

title: Assessing the role of design features and context in social protection programs’ impacts on intimate partner violence (IPV)
narrative: Studies in Ecuador, Bangladesh, and Mali show how design features (e.g., transfer modality, complementary programming) and context (e.g., household structure) shape the magnitude and sustainability of cash transfer programs’ effects on IPV. New work in Ethiopia will explore how adding treatment of maternal depression to social protection programming affects IPV.

title: Assessing strategies to improve resilience for the poor in fragile and low-income settings
narrative: Studies in Mali and Yemen assess the effectiveness of social protection programs in fragile and low-income settings, particularly conflict-affected areas, through opportunistic data collection in regions where conflict broke out while research was ongoing. New work in Ethiopia explicitly tests alternative strategies to reach the poor in a fragile setting.

title: Using smartphone technology to introduce affordable high-quality crop insurance
narrative: We were able to validate picture-based insurance in a proof of concept phase, in terms of farmers being able to take pictures of sufficiently high quality and experts being able to identify visible damage. Future research were work towards automating loss assessment.

title: Zinc Rice: BRRI Dhan84
narrative: variety of biofortified zinc rice

title: Vitamin A Orange Maize: LY1001-14
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Iron beans: NCC 34
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Vitamin A Orange Sweet Potato: IDIAP C9017
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Vitamin A Orange Sweet Potato: IDIAP C0317
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Iron Beans: ICTA Chorti-ACM (SMN 39)
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Wheat: HPBW-01 (Ankur Shiva)
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Wheat: WB-02
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Wheat: BARI-Gom33
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Maize: DICTA B03
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Maize: DICTA B02
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Wheat: BHU-31
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Zinc Wheat: BHU-25
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Iron Beans: INTA BIOF100 (SMR 100)
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Iron Millet: DHBH 1211
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Iron Millet: AHB 1200 (MH 2072)
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Iron Millet: HHB 299 (MH 2076)
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Vitamin A Orange Maize: Sammaz 52 (PVA SYN 13)
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Vitamin A Orange Cassava: YBI2011/323
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Vitamin A Orange Cassava: GKA 2011/274
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Vitamin A Orange Cassava: MVZ 2011B/360
narrative: As with the 260+ biofortified varieties released in the past, these varieties not only have higher levels of micronutrients but are also high-yielding, climate-smart, and carry other attributes farmers and consumers look for.

title: Nutrition sensitive value chains framework
narrative: Value chain approaches can provide useful frameworks to examine the food system and the potential to achieve improved nutritional outcomes. The nutrition-sensitive value chain framework provides a lens to understand the links between value chains, the overall business environment in which they operate, and nutrition among targeted populations.

title: Community outreach nutrition education materials
narrative: Community outreach nutrition education materials on improved recipes using locally available nutrient dense foods based on outputs of linear programming

title: Multi-sectoral policy platform to promote best pratices and pilot programs around biodiversity in Kenya
narrative: The platform is important in terms of leveraging biodiversity to enhance dietary diversity and nutrition and to take advantage of the current interest around improving nutrition and agriculture linkages and are linked to already existing national mechanisms targeting nutrition such as the Nutrition Interagency Coordinating Committee.

title: Solar panel drier for beans and amaranth in Kenya and Uganda
narrative: Environmentally friendly low-cost post-harvest technology (Solar panel drier) piloted in Kenya and Uganda for beans and amaranth (grains, leaves)

title: Self reporting dietary intake tool for use in low literacy populations
narrative: A self reporting dietary intake tool for use in low literacy populations

title: Experimental game played between input dealers and farmers
narrative: Piloted a game being played between input dealers and farmers in a lab-in-field experiment in Bangladesh.  Experiment was adapted from lab experiments conducted among college students in the US

title: Foresight tool for nutrition management practice in Vietnam
narrative: Research on a foresight tool for nutrition management practice in Vietnam;Its output can be used as a scientific foresight tool that can predict the nutrition vulnerability of each province/city for nutrition management practice of National Institute of Nutrition in Vietnam

title: More evidence on positive effects of consumption of iron biofortified beans in Rwanda
narrative: Within the context of an RCT in Rwanda, one group of female college students consumed iron biofortified beans and another group consumed conventional beans. Results showed that the consumption of iron biofortified beans positively affected the cognitive performance of the young women in the treatment group.

title: Aflasafe product for the Gambia and Senegal made available for commercial use
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe product for Kenya
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe BF01 product for Burkina Faso and potentially 10 other countires in the Sahel
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe product GH01 and GH02 for Ghana
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe product for Nigeria
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe product ZM01 and ZM02 for Zambia
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe product TZ01 and TZ02 for Tanzania
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe MWMZ01 product for Malawi and Mozambique
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Aflasafe MW02 for Malawi
narrative: Biocontrol approach to preventing aflatoxin from growing in crops like maize and groundnuts

title: Stories of Change approach
narrative: Stories of Change is a structured case study approach which systematically assesses and analyzes drivers of nutritional change in specific country contexts. These resulting ‘stories’ improve our understanding of what drives impact in reducing undernutrition, and how enabling environments and pro-nutrition policy and implementation processes can be cultivated and sustained.

title: District nutrition profiles for India
narrative: District Nutrition Profiles (640 districts) draw on diverse sources of data to compile a set of indicators on the state of nutrition and its cross-sectoral determinants. The profiles are intended to be conversation-starters about why undernutrition levels are high, and which factors might need to be addressed to improve nutrition.

title: Implementation Notes
narrative: Implementation Notes summarize experiences related to how specific interventions or programs are delivered. They are intended to share information on innovations in delivery.  The latest set of Implementation Notes documents nine examples of program initiatives that have attempted to improve the quality of young children’s diets in India.

title: Data Notes for India
narrative: Data Notes focus on data visualization to highlight geographic and/or thematic issues related to nutrition in India. They draw on multiple sources of publicly available data.

title: Pro-WEAI
narrative: GAAP2 provides a platform for developing and piloting a project-level version of the Women’s Empowerment in Agriculture Index, or pro-WEAI, which will consist of a refined, tested, minimal set of core indicators of women’s empowerment in agriculture, accompanied by additional modules adaptable to the needs of specific projects.

title: Food safety technology: insecticide treated nets
narrative: Piloting the impact of insecticide-treated material to reduce flies among pork outlets in Kampala, Uganda.

title: Food safety technology: waste storage
narrative: Piloting an experimental excreta storage system in Vietnam

title: Food safety technology: kernel sorting
narrative: Piloting multi-spectral kernel sorting to reduce aflatoxins and fumonisins in Kenyan maize

title: Surveillance tool for FBD: Time Series Analysis
narrative: Piloting of time series analysis based on two-part models for excessive zero count data to detect farm-level outbreaks of swine echinococcosis during meat inspections

title: Food safety technology: genetic resistance & fertiliser
narrative: Research on potential of using host plant resistance, nitrogen and phosphorus fertilizers for reduction of Aspergillus flavus colonization and aflatoxin accumulation in maize in Tanzania

title: Research tool: metagenomics for improving food safety
narrative: Metagenomics in food safety: What's the added value? Case studies from the livestock sector in Tanzania and Uganda

title: Research tool: System dynamics model for improving food safety
narrative: Systems approaches for value chain interventions targeting food safety and animal health in smallholder pig value chains

title: Research and policy tools: food safety metrics
narrative: Food safety metrics relevant to low and middle income countries

title: Disease control tool: insurance
narrative: Animal insurance and farmer's behavior in Vietnam

title: Research and policy tool: Health impact assessment
narrative: Assessing potential health impacts of waste recovery and reuse business models in Hanoi, Vietnam

title: Multi-sectoral taskforce on food safety
narrative: A4NH scientists contributed to a range of initiatives which have supported a shift in food safety policy and implementation. One of the most effective initiatives was the National Food Safety Risk Assessment Taskforce.

title: Development intervention: Pig diets for human nutrition and gender equity
narrative: Pilots on impact of individual nursery and finisher Ugandan pigs fed a commercial diet, a forage-based diet, or a silage-based diet and men and women farmers’ perceptions of adopting improved diets for pigs in Uganda: decision‑making, income allocation, and intra‑household strategies that mitigate relative disadvantage

title: Research and policy tool: Risk assessment for food transmitted disease
narrative: Assessing the potential role of pigs in the epidemiology of Ebola virus in Uganda

title: Research and policy tools: Research tool conceptual framework
narrative: Where food safety meets nutrition outcomes in livestock and fish value chains: a conceptual approach

title: Development intervention: guidance for program planning
narrative: Harnessing the potential of livestock to improve nutrition of vulnerable populations: Technical guidance for program planning

title: AMUSE tool
narrative: Piloting a tool for assessing KAP in antimicrobial use

title: Surveillance tool for improving disease control: Predictive mapping
narrative: Collection of tools for predictive mapping on climatic sensitive diseases including: dengue in Vietnam

title: Research tool: models for Rift Valley Fever
narrative: Spatial, seasonal and climatic predictive models of Rift Valley fever disease across Africa

title: Risk Mapping tools
narrative: Predictive mapping based on routine surveillance data: Lessons from dengue risk mapping in Vietnam

title: Research and policy tool: One Health Economics
narrative: One Health economics to confront disease threats

title: Training material for farmer field schools (FFS)
narrative: Training material for farmer field schools (FFS) on reduced Anopheles development in rice fields, RVF and brucellosis

title: Swahili translation of the Vicious Worm health information tool
narrative: The computer-based health-education tool ‘The Vicious Worm’ was developed to create awareness and provide evidence-based health education as a specific measure in control strategies. To increase the reach of the tool, a new version in Swahili was developed and can now be downloaded for free from http://theviciousworm.sites.ku.dk.
